verses.roman:
tān dṛṣṭvā bālakān devī
putra-sneha-snuta-stanī
pariṣvajyāṅkam āropya
mūrdhny ajighrad abhīkṣṇaśaḥ

synonyms: tān—them; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; bālakān—the boys; devī—the goddess (Devakī); putra—for her sons; sneha—due to her affection; snuta—flowing; stanī—whose breasts; pariṣvajya—embracing; aṅkam—on her lap; āropya—placing; mūrdhni—their heads; ajighrat—she smelled; abhīkṣṇaśaḥ—repeatedly.
translation: When she saw her lost children, Goddess Devakī felt such affection for them that milk flowed from her breasts. She embraced them and took them onto her lap, smelling their heads again and again.
